content.full_text: Receipt of Denton Offutt to James Rutledge, 8 March 18321 MrJames Rutledgeplease to pay the bearerDavid P Nelsonthirty dollars and this shall be your receipt for the same
paragraphs: Receipt of Denton Offutt to James Rutledge, 8 March 18321 MrJames Rutledgeplease to pay the bearerDavid P Nelsonthirty dollars and this shall be your receipt for the same

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote the entirely of the text on page one.This document is tipped into Samuel Kirkham,English Grammar in Familiar Lectures(Cincinnati: N. & G. Guilford, 1828).

2Lincoln wrote this note while working as a clerk in Denton Offuttâ€™s store inNew Salem, Illinois. This payment to David P. Nelson likely satisfied debts that Offutt owed
                  Nelson and that James Rutledge owed Offutt for goods at the store.

structured_content.text: Receipt of Denton Offutt to James Rutledge, 8 March 18321
MrJames Rutledgeplease to pay the bearerDavid P Nelsonthirty dollars and this shall be your receipt for the same
